post.description: Creates a new custom business process type, including initiating actions.

200.description: Creates a new custom business process type instance

400.description:
Possible Validations:

- The name for custom business process type is required and must be unique across all custom business process types.

- The name for initiating actions is required and must be unique within a custom business process type.

- The referenceIdValue must be unique across all custom business process types.

- The referenceIdValue for initiatingActions must be unique across all initiating actions.

- Custom object is not valid for target business object.

- You are not allowed to set more than one initiating allowed action as default.

- The Custom Task cannot be used by more than one initiating allowed action.

- The Event Task Definition is required for the Event Action Task Configuration

- The Event Action is required for the Event Action Task Configuration

400.description:
Possible Validations:

-The referenceIdValue must be unique across all custom business process types.

-The name for custom business process type must be unique across all custom business process types.

-Custom object is not valid for target business object.

-Changes to the custom object are not allowed once an event exists for this custom business process.

-Changes to the business object are not allowed once an event exists for this custom business process.

-Changes to the Name are not allowed once an event exists for this custom business process.

-Changes to the ID are not allowed once an event exists for this custom business process.

parameters.description: The Workday Id of the custom business process type

200.description: Deletes a custom business process type for the Id supplied

400.description:
Possible Validations:
- The custom business process type cannot be deleted because it has references.
- You cannot delete a custom business process type that has been used by a business process event.
